jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers package

Submodules

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.AUSMP module

class jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.AUSMP.AUSMP(material_manager: jaxfluids.materials.material_manager.MaterialManager, signal_speed: Callable)[source]

Bases: jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.riemann_solver.RiemannSolver

AUSM+ Scheme - M Liou - 1996 Advetion-Upstream Method Plus according to Liou.

get_phi(primes: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes the phi vector from primitive and conservative variables in which energy is replaced by enthalpy. phi = [rho, rho * velX, rho * velY, rho * velZ, H]

Parameters

  • primes (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables.

  • cons (jax.Array) – Buffer of conservative variables.

Returns

Buffer of phi variable.

Return type

jax.Array

solve_riemann_problem_xi(primes_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, primes_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int, **kwargs) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Solves one-dimensional Riemann problem in the direction as specified by the axis argument.

Parameters

  • primes_L (jax.Array) – primtive variable buffer left of cell face

  • primes_R (jax.Array) – primtive variable buffer right of cell face

  • cons_L (jax.Array) – conservative variable buffer left of cell face

  • cons_R (jax.Array) – conservative variable buffer right of cell face

  • axis (int) – Spatial direction along which Riemann problem is solved.

Returns

buffer of fluxes in xi direction

Return type

jax.Array

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.RusanovNN module

class jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.RusanovNN.RusanovNN(material_manager: jaxfluids.materials.material_manager.MaterialManager, signal_speed: Callable)[source]

Bases: jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.riemann_solver.RiemannSolver

RusanovNN Riemann Solver which is optimied in the JAX-FLUIDS paper. The dissipation is calculated by a neural network. See details in Bezgin et al. 2022.

solve_riemann_problem_xi(primes_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, primes_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int, ml_parameters_dict: Dict, ml_networks_dict: Dict, **kwargs) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.eigendecomposition module

class jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.eigendecomposition.Eigendecomposition(material_manager: jaxfluids.materials.material_manager.MaterialManager, stencil_size: int, domain_information: jaxfluids.domain_information.DomainInformation, flux_splitting: Optional[str] = None)[source]

Bases: object

The Eigendecomposition class implements functionality for eigendecomposition of the Jacobian matrix. Eigendecomposition can be done based on primitive or conservative variables. The frozen state can be calculated from arithmetic or Roe averages.

eigendecomp_prim only returns left and right eigenvectors, while eigendecomp_cons additionally returns eigenvalues according to a user-specified flux-splitting.

compute_frozen_state(primes: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]
compute_roe_cons(prime_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, prime_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes the Roe averaged conservative state.

Parameters

  • prime_L (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables left of a cell face.

  • prime_R (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables right of a cell face.

Returns

Buffer of Roe averaged quantities at the cell face.

Return type

jax.Array

eigendecomp_cons(primes: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int) → Union[Tuple[jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase], Tuple[jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase]][source]

Computes eigendecomposition of the Jacobian matrix for conservative variables. Formulation for a general equation of state. Implementation according to Fedkiv et al.

Parameters

  • primes (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables.

  • axis (int) – Direction of the cell face at which the eigendecomposition is to be performed.

Returns

Buffer of left, right eigenvectors and the eigenvalues.

Return type

Union[Tuple[jax.Array, jax.Array], Tuple[jax.Array, jax.Array, jax.Array]]

eigendecomp_prim(primes: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int) → Tuple[jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase][source]

Computes the eigendecomposition of the Jacobian matrix wrt primitive variables.

Parameters

  • primes (jax.Array) – Buffer of primitive variables.

  • axis (int) – Direction of the cell face at which the eigendecomposition is to be performed.

Returns

Buffer of left and right eigenvectors.

Return type

Tuple[jax.Array, jax.Array]

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.riemann_solver module

class jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.riemann_solver.RiemannSolver(material_manager: jaxfluids.materials.material_manager.MaterialManager, signal_speed: Callable)[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract base class for Riemann solvers.

RiemannSolver has two fundamental attributes: a material manager and a signal speed. The solve_riemann_problem_xi method solves the one-dimensional Riemann problem.

eps = 2.220446049250313e-16
abstract solve_riemann_problem_xi(primes_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, primes_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, cons_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, axis: int, **kwargs) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Solves one-dimensional Riemann problem in the direction as specified by the axis argument.

Parameters

  • primes_L (jax.Array) – primtive variable buffer left of cell face

  • primes_R (jax.Array) – primtive variable buffer right of cell face

  • cons_L (jax.Array) – conservative variable buffer left of cell face

  • cons_R (jax.Array) – conservative variable buffer right of cell face

  • axis (int) – Spatial direction along which Riemann problem is solved.

Returns

buffer of fluxes in xi direction

Return type

jax.Array

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.signal_speeds module

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.signal_speeds.compute_sstar(u_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, u_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, p_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, p_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, S_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, S_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes the speed of the intermediate wave in a Riemann problem.

See Toro Eq. (10.70)

Parameters

  • u_L (jax.Array) – Buffer with normal velocity in left neighboring cell.

  • u_R (jax.Array) – Buffer with normal velocity in right neighboring cell.

  • p_L (jax.Array) – Pressure of left neighboring cell.

  • p_R (jax.Array) – Pressure of right neighboring cells.

  • rho_L (jax.Array) – Density of left neighboring cell.

  • rho_R (jax.Array) – Density of right neighboring cell.

  • S_L (jax.Array) – Wave speed estimate left-going wave.

  • S_R (jax.Array) – Wave speed estimate right-going wave.

Returns

Speed of the intermediate wave in the Riemann problem.

Return type

jax.Array

jaxfluids.solvers.riemann_solvers.signal_speeds.estimate_pressure(u_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, u_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, a_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, a_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, p_L: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, p_R: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Estimates the pressure in the star region based on a linearised solution in terms of primitive variables.

See Toro Eq. (9.28) or (10.67)

Parameters

  • u_L (jax.Array) – Buffer with normal velocity in left neighboring cell.

  • u_R (jax.Array) – Buffer with normal velocity in right neighboring cell.

  • a_L (jax.Array) – Buffer with speed of sound in left neighboring cell.

  • a_R (jax.Array) – Buffer with speed of sound in right neighboring cell.

  • rho_L (jax.Array) – Densities of left neighboring cells.

  • rho_R (jax.Array) – Densities of right neighboring cells.

  • p_L (jax.Array) – Pressure of left neighboring cell.

  • p_R (jax.Array) – Pressure of right neighboring cells.

Returns

Pressure in the star region.

Return type

jax.Array
